issues.description: Interface naming mismatch: the problem statement and template refer to an interface named `Rideable`, yet the solution repository defines this interface as `Mountable` and omits `Rideable`. As a result, code in Main.java and class declarations implementing `Rideable` will not compile and students will be confused about which interface to use.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the `Mountable` interface in the solution repository to `Rideable`, update all implementing classes (Seal, Pig) to implement `Rideable`, and ensure all references in Main.java and elsewhere use `Rideable` to match the specification.

issues.description: The interface for riding is named `Rideable` in both the problem statement and the template (e.g., Main.java uses `Rideable[] rideables`), but in the solution repository the interface is unintentionally named `Mountable`. This mismatched naming for the same conceptual entity (animals that can be ridden) will confuse students mapping the problem requirements to the reference solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the `Mountable` interface in the solution repository to `Rideable` (and update `Pig.java` and `Seal.java` to implement `Rideable`) so that the interface name matches the problem statement and template.
